1 Permutation Synchronisation in a Nutshell Permutation synchronisation is a procedure to improve matchings between multiple objects [23,34], and related concepts have been utilised to address diverse tasks, such as multi-alignment [7,5, 5
25], multi-shape matching [22,24,20], multi-image matching [51,42,9,13,12], or multi-graph matching [48,6,41], among many others.

Motion segmentation with pairwise matche.1: Permutation synchronization is hard to solve due to the combinatorial nature of the problem, hence existing approaches usually rely on approximate solutions (see [30], [31], [32], [33], [34], [35], [36], [37]).
Motion segmentation with pairwise matche.2: Among existing methods, we are particularly interested in MatchEIG [34] and QuickMatch [35], which are illustrated here and will be used in the next section.
Motion segmentation with pairwise matche.3: The authors of [35] interpret the measurement matrix as the adjacency matrix of a graph, hence permutation synchronization is cast to a “graph clustering” problem.
